column1: Uyui District is one of the seven districts of the Tabora Region of Tanzania.  It is bordered to the north by Nzega District and Igunga District as well as by the Shinyanga Region
column2: to the south by Sikonge District
column3: to the west by Urambo District and Kaliua District
column4: and to the east by the Singida Region. Tabora Urban District is an enclave within the Uyui District. Its administrative seat is the city of Tabora.

column1: According to the 2002 Tanzania National Census
column2: the population of the Uyui District was 281

column1: The district includes the Mbola cluster of Millennium villages.According to the 2012 Tanzania National Census
column2: the population of Uyui District was 396

column1: Unpaved Trunk road T18 from Singida Region to Kigoma and unpaved trunk road T8 from Mbeya to Mwanza pass through the district.The Tanzanian Central Line train - from Dar es Salaam to Kigoma - passes through the district.

column2: Uyui District was administratively divided into 24 wards.
